statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Niagara 87, Canisius 82
article.story: BUFFALO, N.Y. (AP) -- Juan Mendez scored 30 points to lead Niagara to an 87-82 victory over Canisius in each team's Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference opener Wednesday night. With Niagara (4-1, 1-0 MAAC) leading by one with 3:33 left in the second half, Mendez hit a pair of free throws to push the lead to three. After a defensive stop, the Purple Eagles pushed their lead to five when David Brooks corraled a blocked putback attempt by Mendez and hit a field goal with 2:14 remaining. But Canisius (1-2, 0-1 MAAC) made it a one-possession game after Dewitt Doss hit two free throws with 51.3 seconds left, making it 81-78. The Golden Griffins press caused Brooks to turn the ball over out of bounds, and Doss put up a difficult field goal attempt that missed. Niagara put the game away with a free throw by Mathis followed by a steal and layup by Brooks, making the score 84-78 with 17.7 seconds left. Lorenzo Miles scored 17 points for the Purple Eagles, who won their fourth straight game. James Mathis had 13 points and 13 rebounds. Charron Fisher added 12 points and Brooks had 10. Doss led Canisius with 22 points. Kevin Downey, who scored all eight points during an 8-2 Golden Griffins run that made it 77-76, had 21 points. Niagara has won seven of the last eight meetings with Canisius.
